intro: Gymnosporia maritima, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers and its ability to thrive in coastal environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds. Gymnosporia maritima is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines. Its hardy nature makes it well adapted to salt spray and strong winds.
